value.title: DAX Fridays #209: Open orders in DAX | Events in progress & Time intelligence
value.excerpt: In today's video, we are going to go through how to think about Time Intelligence calculations with a specific case: Calculating the number of open orders using DAX.  I read a million years ago a blog post from Gerhard where he explained how to do it and even though we are not going to use the same DAX

value.title: Using the SELECTEDVALUE function in DAX

value.title: Wednesday with DAX in Power BI
value.excerpt: Welcome to my new Power BI DAX Series. Every Wednesday, we will talk about different DAX functions.

topItems.title: DAX Functions Overview - Date and Time Function in Power BI
topItems.excerpt: Welcome to my new series ‚Äì ‚ÄúWednesday with DAX‚Äù. This is the first video of this series. topItems.title: After Union Two tables, data goes to the wrong column with Power BI DAX?
topItems.excerpt: Most of us have used Union DAX expression in Power BI. Basically union, appends rows from both the table which are common. In Power BI, sometimes, when we perform Union operation, the combined data have some inconsistent mechanism, meaning one column's data merged with another column. The main reason
